content:
• Monday, January 9, 2012
  • WDFC

    More on WD-40 (NASDAQ:WDFC): FQ1 earnings dropped 25% Y/Y, as the company's bottom line...

    More on WD-40 (NASDAQ:WDFC): FQ1 earnings dropped 25% Y/Y, as the company's bottom line continues to get hit, largely due to the impact of high commodity costs and an unfavorable mix of products weighing heavily on margins. Share -8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:20 PM | 3 Comments
  • SMSC

    More on Standard Microsystems (NASDAQ:SMSC): FQ3 comes in line on revenue, but misses on a per...

    More on Standard Microsystems (NASDAQ:SMSC): FQ3 comes in line on revenue, but misses on a per share basis due to weak PC, industrial and other consumer product demand. The company also projects a steeper than historical seasonal sales decline due to a combination of continued weak demand and lower post holiday consumer product sales. Shares -7.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:10 PM
  • QUIK

    QuickLogic Corporation (NASDAQ:QUIK) slips in post-trading after saying Q4 revenue will come in...

    QuickLogic Corporation (NASDAQ:QUIK) slips in post-trading after saying Q4 revenue will come in below estimates. It now expects to earn approximately $4.3M, below Street consensus of $5M. Shares -3.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:52 PM
  • HMA

    Health Management Associates (NYSE:HMA) trades lower after hours, despite raising its Q4...

    Health Management Associates (NYSE:HMA) trades lower after hours, despite raising its Q4 outlook, citing improved cost controls and effective hospital partnerships that boosted its bottom line. The company now expects to earn an EPS of $0.25 to $0.26 per share on $1.58B in revenue, compared to the Street view of $1.58B in revenue and earnings of $0.18 per share. Shares -2.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:36 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA -9.2%) ended an ugly day trading 20% below its IPO price. Aside from Playdom's...

    Zynga (ZNGA -9.2%) ended an ugly day trading 20% below its IPO price. Aside from Playdom's (NYSE:DIS) unveiling of Marvel: Avengers Alliance for Facebook, there wasn't any noteworthy news to move shares. But bearish opinions are easy to find: Dave Thier argues Zynga's problem is that rising customer expectations force it to develop more expensive games to generate the same amount of revenue, all while competition grows.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:30 PM | 4 Comments
  • BKS

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +4.1%) pared some of the huge losses it saw last week following its FY12...

    Barnes & Noble (BKS +4.1%) pared some of the huge losses it saw last week following its FY12 warning/Nook spinoff announcement. A possible reason could be B&N's introduction of Nook hardware discounts (I, II) for those who agree to a one-year subscription for either the New York Times (NYSE:NYT) or People Magazine. The subscriptions cost $240/year and $120/year, respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • GCO

    Apparel retailer Genesco (NYSE:GCO) gains 2.9% AH after announcing same-store sales have risen...

    Apparel retailer Genesco (NYSE:GCO) gains 2.9% AH after announcing same-store sales have risen 13% Y/Y thus far in its current quarter, fueled by the strong performance of its Journeys and Lids Sports brands. Due to the better-than-expected sales, Genesco now expects FQ4 (ends Jan. 28) EPS of $1.63-$1.68, above a $1.60 consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM
  • ELX

    Emulex (NYSE:ELX) gains 8.3% AH after announcing it expects FQ2 revenue of $127M-$128M and EPS...

    Emulex (NYSE:ELX) gains 8.3% AH after announcing it expects FQ2 revenue of $127M-$128M and EPS of $0.24-$0.25, above a consensus of $124M and $0.17. The company, whose shares had been hit by concerns about Thai flooding exposure, says its operations are now back to full capacity. Top rival QLogic (NASDAQ:QLGC) is up 3.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • MEAS

    Sensor maker Measurement Specialties (NASDAQ:MEAS) falls 3.3% AH after warning it expects FQ3...

    Sensor maker Measurement Specialties (NASDAQ:MEAS) falls 3.3% AH after warning it expects FQ3 revenue of ~$76M, below a consensus of $79.6M. In addition, the company is guiding for FQ4 revenue of $81M-$84M, below an $85.3M consensus.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:55 PM
  • CRUS

    In a season filled with chipmaker warnings, Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS) is preannouncing in the...

    In a season filled with chipmaker warnings, Cirrus Logic (NASDAQ:CRUS) is preannouncing in the opposite direction: the company says it expects FQ3 revenue of $122M, well above a consensus of $105.1M, and is also guiding for FQ4 revenue of $105M, above a $98.5M consensus. Cirrus' announcement could be another indication of strong iPhone demand, given it supplies an audio codec chip for the 4S. Shares +7.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • KATE

    Liz Claiborne (LIZ) announces lower guidance for 2012, saying it nows sees adjusted EBITDA...

    Liz Claiborne (LIZ) announces lower guidance for 2012, saying it nows sees adjusted EBITDA falling in a range of $125M-$140M - lower than its previous estimate of $130M-$150M. Shares sink 8.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • JNPR

    Juniper (NYSE:JNPR) drops 3.6% AH after warning it expects Q4 revenue of $1.1B-$1.2B and EPS of...

    Juniper (NYSE:JNPR) drops 3.6% AH after warning it expects Q4 revenue of $1.1B-$1.2B and EPS of $0.26-$0.28, largely below a consensus of $1.19B and $0.34. In what appears to be a vindication of negative comments made last month by UBS, Juniper blames the shortfall on weak service provider demand, particularly in the U.S.. CSCO -0.8%. CIEN -1.4%. FFIV -1.1%. RVBD -1.4%. ALU -1.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:24 PM
  • JNPR

    Networking stocks enjoy a big boost after Juniper (JNPR +5.4%) and F5 (FFIV +3.7%) get upbeat...

    Networking stocks enjoy a big boost after Juniper (JNPR +5.4%) and F5 (FFIV +3.7%) get upbeat reviews from Sanjiv Wadhani of Stifel Nicolaus, who says his checks "show that the pipeline is solid, which should bodes well for March quarter guidance." Juniper likely will report an in-line quarter, he says, noting that bookings appeared to pick up in December.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 2 Comments
  • P

    Pandora Media (P +4.3%) is set go out near its highs after being initiated with a Buy on...

    Pandora Media (P +4.3%) is set go out near its highs after being initiated with a Buy on valuation earlier at Needham.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • PENN

    Penn National Gaming (PENN +4.4%) gains after Credit Suisse adds the stock to its U.S. Focus...

    Penn National Gaming (PENN +4.4%) gains after Credit Suisse adds the stock to its U.S. Focus List, citing an attractive valuation and potential upside stemming from a strengthening U.S. consumer market and the potential of future projects, including three new casinos in Kansas City, Kansas and Toledo, Ohio.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:50 PM
  • DNDN

    Shares of Dendreon (DNDN +8.8%) extend their amazing three-day run, up nearly 80% since...

    Shares of Dendreon (DNDN +8.8%) extend their amazing three-day run, up nearly 80% since pre-announcing better-than-expected Q4 revenue and revealing growing sales of its Provenge prostate cancer therapy. Too much too fast? William Blair's Katherine Xu “continue[s] to be concerned with Provenge’s eventual potential and profitability."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • HNT

    Health Net (HNT +3.3%) advances after announcing earlier it's selling its Medicare...

    Health Net (HNT +3.3%) advances after announcing earlier it's selling its Medicare prescription-drug plan business to CVS Caremark (CVS +0.7%) for approximately $160M in an all cash deal.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • SEEL

    Apricus Bioscience (APRI +4.8%) trades higher after Abbott Laboratories (NYSE:ABT) signs an...

    Apricus Bioscience (APRI +4.8%) trades higher after Abbott Laboratories (NYSE:ABT) signs an exclusive licensing and marketing agreement with the company to sell Vitaros, Apricus' treatment for erectile dysfunction, in Canada.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • GOOG

    Wall Street is starting to worry about Google (GOOG -4.1%) becoming hitched to a lemon after...

    Wall Street is starting to worry about Google (GOOG -4.1%) becoming hitched to a lemon after Motorola Mobility's (MMI -0.7%) Q4 warning reflects difficult competition among mobile device makers. Yes, acquiring MMI's patents is the "least bad" way to counter Apple and Microsoft, Cowen's Jim Friedland says, but "unfortunately, the patents are saddled with MMI's poorly performing handset business."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM | 4 Comments
  • AVNW

    Aviat Networks (AVNW +15.8%) ramps higher today after reafirming FQ2 revenue, saying it to...

    Aviat Networks (AVNW +15.8%) ramps higher today after reafirming FQ2 revenue, saying it to expects FQ2 revenue to be in the range of $100M - $110M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:57 PM
  • COST

    Costco (COST -2.1%) shares are lowered to Underperform at Bernstein, which notes that the...

    Costco (COST -2.1%) shares are lowered to Underperform at Bernstein, which notes that the warehouse-style retailer's operating margins have come under pressure in the past two quarters. "We expect this pressure to persist, making current consensus forecasts look far too optimistic," the firm says.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:54 PM
  • MPC

    U.S. refining margins are worse than previously thought, Simmons Co. says in lowering its Q4...

    U.S. refining margins are worse than previously thought, Simmons Co. says in lowering its Q4 earnings forecasts for the industry. The firm projects Marathon Petroleum's (MPC -3.6%) EPS at zero, down from its earlier estimate of $0.70, and Holly Frontier (HFC -3.2%) will post a $1.20 gain, down from $1.26. Other refiners, including Valero (VLO -3.3%) and Delek (DK -4.7%), also are lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • TDY

    LeCroy (LCRY +17.5%) skyrockets after announcing it expects FQ2 (ended in December) revenue of...

    LeCroy (LCRY +17.5%) skyrockets after announcing it expects FQ2 (ended in December) revenue of $51.1M and EPS of $0.30; the latter is in-line, while the former beats consensus by $0.8M, assuaging fears that macro issues would affect demand for LeCroy's electronics testing gear. LeCroy also says its board has approved a new 5M share buyback, good for 30% of outstanding shares. (October report)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • BHC

    Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX +2.6%) firms after Jefferies raises its 12-month price target to...

    Valeant Pharmaceuticals (VRX +2.6%) firms after Jefferies raises its 12-month price target to $75 from $64, saying FY12 guidance was even better than its optimistic forecasts, and it's encouraged by the company's stated goal of becoming a top 15 Pharmaceutical company by the end of 2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • STJ

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +3.1%) reaffirms Q4 EPS guidance and sees revenues in-line at $1.4B -...

    St. Jude Medical (STJ +3.1%) reaffirms Q4 EPS guidance and sees revenues in-line at $1.4B - "better-than-feared" and "a sigh of relief," Leerink Swann says. But a 4% decline in Q4 cardiac rhythm sales suggests continued softness in the U.S. market for implantable defibrillators, whose sales have slumped on concerns of overuse and a Department of Justice investigation.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • ITMN

    Shares of InterMune (ITMN +10.4%) go on an INHX-inspired tear. The firm offers a protease...

    Shares of InterMune (ITMN +10.4%) go on an INHX-inspired tear. The firm offers a protease inhibitor used by Roche's Hepatitis C treatment candidate.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • MR

    Chinese medical device maker Mindray Medical (MR +6.4%) surges after preannouncing 2011 revenue...

    Chinese medical device maker Mindray Medical (MR +6.4%) surges after preannouncing 2011 revenue of $878M, above a Street forecast of $856.8M. Mindray also expects its 2011 net income to rise at least 10% (current consensus is for 9% growth), and is guiding for 2012 revenue growth of at least 18% (consensus of 17.3%). (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • ZLTQ

    Zeltiq Aesthetics (ZLTQ -6.6%) retreats after the firm announces that its CFO has retired and...

    Zeltiq Aesthetics (ZLTQ -6.6%) retreats after the firm announces that its CFO has retired and will be replaced internally. Shares are now flat for the year after seeing a decent spike last week.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • NFLX

    Despite Netflix (NFLX +8.2%) rising over 30% already this year, Whitney Tilson reckons the stock...

    Despite Netflix (NFLX +8.2%) rising over 30% already this year, Whitney Tilson reckons the stock "should go crazy to the upside." Tilson gives four reasons: the Street overreacted to the downside; Netflix is an easy acquisition for large players; its new services in the U.K. and Ireland; and U.S. subscriber growth is growing again.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:37 PM | 10 Comments
  • OLED

    Universal Display (PANL +5%) is rallying, perhaps thanks to LG's unveiling at CES of a 55-inch,...

    Universal Display (PANL +5%) is rallying, perhaps thanks to LG's unveiling at CES of a 55-inch, 5mm-thick OLED TV, which it claims is the world's largest. The news is apparently overshadowing a report that Sony (NYSE:SNE) is exiting the consumer OLED TV market. DisplaySearch expects the OLED TV market to take off in the coming years, as manufacturing advances lower currently-exorbitant prices. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM
  • MS

    Morgan Stanley (MS +1.6%) says it's getting a new legal head, appointing Eric Grossman to...

    Morgan Stanley (MS +1.6%) says it's getting a new legal head, appointing Eric Grossman to succeed Frank Barron as Chief Legal Officer. Barron will be retiring later this year.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM
  • TRNX

    Tornier (TRNX +4.3%) jumps after announcing preliminary Q4 sales of $69M (+12.7% Y/Y), beating...

    Tornier (TRNX +4.3%) jumps after announcing preliminary Q4 sales of $69M (+12.7% Y/Y), beating Street estimates by $1.9M. The Dutch medical device maker's growth was driven by a 17.5% Y/Y increase in sales of prosthetics for extremities.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM
  • BMY

    Other Hepatitis C drug-developers' shares rally on the back of Bristol-Myers (BMY -1.1%) plans...

    Other Hepatitis C drug-developers' shares rally on the back of Bristol-Myers (BMY -1.1%) plans to buy Inhibitex (INHX +141%): Idenix Pharmaceuticals (IDIX +34%), Achillion Pharmaceuticals (ACHN +16%) and Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX +4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • HMA

    Shares of Health Management (HMA -7.8%) head straight north after Susquehanna's AJ Rice advises...

    Shares of Health Management (HMA -7.8%) head straight north after Susquehanna's AJ Rice advises clients of the firm to buy on weakness. HMA was down over 12% earlier due to concerns about a CRT Capital report on a lawsuit from one of the firm's ex-auditors.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • BRCD

    Brocade Communications (BRCD +8.9%) is halted after skying on a Reuters report it has received...

    Brocade Communications (BRCD +8.9%) is halted after skying on a Reuters report it has received bids from a "handful" of buyers. The firm has reportedly hired Qatalyst Partners (Frank Quattrone) to explore a sale.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM
  • PYX

    Alliance One International (AOI +4.08%) says its Brazilian subsidiary Alliance One Brasil...

    Alliance One International (AOI +4.08%) says its Brazilian subsidiary Alliance One Brasil Exportadora de Tabacos has agreed to form a new joint venture with China Tabaco Internacional do Brasil. Under the agreement, Alliance One Brazil will transfer to the joint venture production contracts with approximately 6K integrated farmers for the upcoming 2011/12 crop.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • OCZ

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +2.3%) OCZ) today anounced that it has acquired privately-held SANRAD, a...

    OCZ Technology (OCZ +2.3%) OCZ) today anounced that it has acquired privately-held SANRAD, a provider of flash caching and virtualization software and hardware, for $15 million.">acquires privately-held SANRAD, a provider of flash caching and virtualization software and hardware, for $15M in an all-stock transaction.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:35 PM
  • PSMT

    PriceSmart (PSMT -3.2%) which was crushed on Friday after reporting weak FQ1 results, sells off...

    PriceSmart (PSMT -3.2%) which was crushed on Friday after reporting weak FQ1 results, sells off again today after announcing same-store sales rose 19.9% Y/Y, and total sales rose 22.7%, in December. This compares with growth of 18.5% and 23.1%, respectively, in November.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • RL

    Goldman Sachs adds Ralph Lauren (RL +4.1%) to its Conviction Buy List, seeing upside potential...

    Goldman Sachs adds Ralph Lauren (RL +4.1%) to its Conviction Buy List, seeing upside potential for shares as inflation costs recede and Asia expansion looks promising. The take on RL follows a bullish theme (I, II, III) across the luxury retail sector - largely viewed as relatively unfazed by a slumping global economy and discounting headaches.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • IGT

    International Game Technology (IGT -3.2%) trades lower after Credit Suisse removes the stock...

    International Game Technology (IGT -3.2%) trades lower after Credit Suisse removes the stock from its Focus List but maintains its outperform rating, saying it no longer considers the stock to be one of its best ideas.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • AYI

    Lighting fixture maker Acuity Brands (AYI +11.8%) soars after reporting FQ1 (ended in November)...

    Lighting fixture maker Acuity Brands (AYI +11.8%) soars after reporting FQ1 (ended in November) sales of $474.3M (+12% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.74, beating Street estimates by $8.2M and $0.15. The company's operating margin rose 50 bps Y/Y, to 11.2%. Acuity is also reiterating its forecast for low-to-mid single-digit growth for the North American lighting market in its fiscal 2012. (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • CMCSA

    Macquarie raises its rating on Comcast (CMCSA +2%) shares to Outperform from Neutral, citing...

    Macquarie raises its rating on Comcast (CMCSA +2%) shares to Outperform from Neutral, citing "the strongest underlying metrics in the group, an improved capital returns outlook, and significant upside potential in turning around NBCU." The firm sees "significant upside" for the stock despite already gaining 13% vs. 6% for the the sector in the past three months. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • AVGO

    Avago Technologies (AVGO +6.9%) spikes higher after Nomura and Deutsche both upgrade the analog...

    Avago Technologies (AVGO +6.9%) spikes higher after Nomura and Deutsche both upgrade the analog chipmaker. Nomura touts Avago's low valuation, and thinks Street estimates are too low given rebounding industrial demand and the company's strong wireless position. An Avago power amplifier is built into the iPhone 4S.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • AMRX

    Impax Laboratories (IPXL +5.4%) catches a bid after Canaccord Genuity upgrades the firm to Buy...

    Impax Laboratories (IPXL +5.4%) catches a bid after Canaccord Genuity upgrades the firm to Buy from Hold with a lofty price target of $28. Shares hit a 6-month high on the strength of the buying flurry.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:40 AM
  • AFL

    Aflac (AFL -3.7%) is cut to Sell from Neutral at UBS with a reduced price target of $34 from...

    Aflac (AFL -3.7%) is cut to Sell from Neutral at UBS with a reduced price target of $34 from $39, citing remaining overexposure to Europe despite de-risking efforts. UBS also flags the potential for decelerating EPS growth at the insurer, in part because the company could slow share buybacks if significant European credit losses materialize.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 1 Comment
  • ACOR

    Biotechnology firm Acorda Therapeutics (ACOR +4%) gains after saying that due to successful...

    Biotechnology firm Acorda Therapeutics (ACOR +4%) gains after saying that due to successful marketing efforts, it expects sales of Ampyra to rise to $255M - $275M in 2012, up from $210M last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:33 AM
  • VEON

    Russian carrier VimpelCom (VIP +2.6%) trades higher after announcing a memorandum of...

    Russian carrier VimpelCom (VIP +2.6%) trades higher after announcing a memorandum of understanding with the Algerian government regarding the sale by its Orascom subsidiary of a majority stake in local carrier Djezzy. Orascom, which is 51.7%-owned by VimpelCom of, has been under pressure to sell Djezzy after the Algerian government said it wants the carrier nationalized. A price still has to be determined.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • MDAS

    Tremblant Capital discloses a stake (13G) in SodaStream (MDAS -1.4%) of 9.79%, marking the first...

    Tremblant Capital discloses a stake (13G) in SodaStream (MDAS -1.4%) of 9.79%, marking the first time it revealed an ownership position in the beverage carbonation systems manufacturer.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • AMAG

    AMAG Pharmaceuticals (AMAG -5.8%) trades lower after the company says it expects Q4 sales to...

    AMAG Pharmaceuticals (AMAG -5.8%) trades lower after the company says it expects Q4 sales to come in below consensus. It now expects revenue in the range of $14.3M - $15M, below analysts' estimates of $16M.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • STE

    Shares of Steris (STE -4.1%) get stung by a downgrade from analysts at CL King who take their...

    Shares of Steris (STE -4.1%) get stung by a downgrade from analysts at CL King who take their rating down on the infection prevention firm to Sell from Neutral.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM
  • ATX

    High-end penmaker A.T. Cross (ATX -17.2%) tumbles after announcing it expects 2011 EPS of...

    High-end penmaker A.T. Cross (ATX -17.2%) tumbles after announcing it expects 2011 EPS of $0.62-$0.65 and 2012 EPS of $0.70-$0.75, below consensus estimates of $0.66 and $0.84, respectively. The company blames the 2011 shortfall on a 6% Y/Y revenue decline in its Accessory division in Q4, thanks to weak European sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM
  • AA

    Alcoa (AA +3.3%) gets a lift this morning from an article in Barron's over the weekend that...

    Alcoa (AA +3.3%) gets a lift this morning from an article in Barron's over the weekend that suggests aluminum prices may have bottomed and the stock could benefit from bargain hunting as mining capacity is rationalized. Morgan Stanley's Paretosh Misra sees Alcoa as a defensive play with less downside risk to aluminium than other commodities.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM | 2 Comments
  • IMAX

    IMAX (IMAX +4.4%) and Cinemas Guzzo announce a JV to install four digital IMAX theatre systems...

    IMAX (IMAX +4.4%) and Cinemas Guzzo announce a JV to install four digital IMAX theatre systems in Montreal, bringing the total number of theatres open or contracted to open in Canada to 30. Heard On The Street's John Jannarone thinks increasing demand for IMAX screens - with an order backlog of 580-600 by the end of 2012 - means several years of growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • HUM

    Metropolitan Health Networks (MDF +5.1%) shoots higher on heavy volume after the health care...

    Metropolitan Health Networks (MDF +5.1%) shoots higher on heavy volume after the health care provider sector sees upward revisions for medicare plans this year.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • HGG

    Hhgregg (HGG -4.1%) trades lower today after shares went on a roller coaster ride last week....

    Hhgregg (HGG -4.1%) trades lower today after shares went on a roller coaster ride last week. Schaeffer's Investment Research says all the hubbub is attributable to some heavy options trading on the bearish side that's dominating action.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:43 AM
  • MED

    Medifast (MED -2.9%) dips after an article in Barron's over the weekend says the company is...

    Medifast (MED -2.9%) dips after an article in Barron's over the weekend says the company is losing its competitive edge and alienating investors as Weight Watchers (WTW -0.5%) runs away with the business. The stock has fallen 50% over the past 12 months, and could easily fall another 20% from current levels.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • F

    Ford (F +1.5%) CEO Alan Mulally tells CNBC the firm expects auto industry sales to hit 13.5M-14M...

    Ford (F +1.5%) CEO Alan Mulally tells CNBC the firm expects auto industry sales to hit 13.5M-14M vehicles this year, coming in on the upper end or exceeding the expectations of market watchers (I, II).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:29 AM
  • ANF

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -2%) dips after Brean Murray cuts the shares to Hold, citing weak...

    Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF -2%) dips after Brean Murray cuts the shares to Hold, citing weak holiday sales and high discounting from its peers, plus economic uncertainty that could impact international sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • MAKO

    Mako Surgical (MAKO +10%) reports selling 18 of its RIO surgical platform systems during Q4, vs....

    Mako Surgical (MAKO +10%) reports selling 18 of its RIO surgical platform systems during Q4, vs. 13 systems sold in the year-ago period, and says 2,258 MAKOplasty procedures were performed in Q4, a 25% increase Q/Q and 97% gain Y/Y. MAKO anticipates selling 56-62 RIO systems and 11K-13K procedures performed in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM
  • OPEN

    OpenTable (OPEN +7.1%) pounds out a gain on the strength of an upgrade from Barclays to...

    OpenTable (OPEN +7.1%) pounds out a gain on the strength of an upgrade from Barclays to Overweight from Equalweight, overlooking the $7 price target cut to $46 analysts with the firm lined up.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • CFN

    CareFusion (NYSE:CFN) dives 8.2% following its earnings warning, making its one of the biggest...

    CareFusion (NYSE:CFN) dives 8.2% following its earnings warning, making its one of the biggest fallers in the S&P 500.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
  • AKAM

    Akamai (AKAM -1.8%) shares sink after Citigroup lowers its rating to Sell from Neutral, citing...

    Akamai (AKAM -1.8%) shares sink after Citigroup lowers its rating to Sell from Neutral, citing valuation after an "overly aggressive" stock price reaction to last month's purchase of Cotendo and greater competition from Amazon's (NASDAQ:AMZN) CloudFront CDN business. On the Cotendo deal, it is “not clear that Cotendo will provide Akamai material new products of market opportunities."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM
